desc:
Welcome to my first yargs lightning talk!

My name is Andrew. I'm a yargs maintainer and I work for npm, Inc. (Yes, we sell products!)

Let's start with the basics of a CLI in Node.

1. shebang: #!/usr/bin/env node

2. executable file: chmod +x cli.js

3. Declare "bin" in package.json

4. install yargs: npm i --save yargs

Official successor to optimist by substack.

- chainable config methods

- synchronous

- .argv parsing

- help/usage text

- validation

- commands

- auto help and version flags

- config files

And more!

Configure yargs to look for flagged args

Use the .option() method

Specify a flag name and meta object

Basic example:

Define:
- name, alias
- description
- type (string, boolean, number, etc)
- default value
- required?
- group for help content
- global? (preserved for commands)

.help(): when --help flag given, print help text and exit

.version(): when --version flag given, lookup version from package.json, print and exit
Normally just thrown in argv._ (array of strings)
You can define these as 'commmands' as well via .command() method

Handy methods:
- .usage(): Synopsis of how to use your CLI
- .example(): Give some examples of commands
- .epilog(): Outro text
- .wrap(): Control spacing

Use .check() for custom post-parsing validation

Use .fail() for custom error handling

More control with .showHelpOnFail(false) and .exitProcess(false) <not shown below>

- config files
- config in package.json
- env var support
- command modules
- i18n support
- other validation
- bash completion support

That's it for now, thanks for listening!

Check out the yargs website and docs at yargs.js.org

Contact me @nexdrew
